analyzed: yang na stong 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po rtsibs kyi mu khyud lta bu 'thob ces dbang po tha ma'i lam mo //
translated: Alternatively, one will attain the state of a great universal monarch with a thousand wheels, like Cakraviṃśa.

original: tshe 'dir mchog ma thob na'ang bar ma dor dkyil 'khor lo'i snang ba dang mi 'bral bar dag pa'i zhing khams su spyod par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: tshe 'dir mchog ma thob na'ang bar ma dor dkyil 'khor lo'i snang ba dang mi 'bral bar dag pa'i zhing khams su spyod par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Even if one does not attain the supreme state in this life, one will experience the pure buddha fields without being separated from the vision of the maṇḍala in the intermediate state.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams 'pho ba'i tshe //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams 'pho ba'i tshe //
translated: When the yogins and yoginīs transfer their consciousness,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it is said:

original: sgrub pa po rim pa gnyis la rtags sna 'ga' tsam las ma thob na yang /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rim pa gnyis la rtags sna 'ga' tsam las ma thob na yang /
translated: Even if the practitioner has not attained more than a few signs of the two stages,

original: bar ma dor zhal ston par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: bar ma dor zhal ston par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: the maṇḍala will appear in the intermediate state.

original: dpal ldan khrag 'thung ni bcom ldan 'das nyid rdo rje btsun mo dang bcas pa dang / sogs ni dpa' bo rnams thams cad dang / mkha' 'gro sa gsum na gnas pa thams cad yul nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang 'og min na bzhugs pa'i lha tshogs kyis lag na me tog sna tshogs thogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpal ldan khrag 'thung ni bcom ldan 'das nyid rdo rje btsun mo dang bcas pa dang / sogs ni dpa' bo rnams thams cad dang / mkha' 'gro sa gsum na gnas pa thams cad yul nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang 'og min na bzhugs pa'i lha tshogs kyis lag na me tog sna tshogs thogs pa ste /
translated: The glorious herukas are the Bhagavān himself with the Vajra Queen, and so on, all the heroes, and all the ḍākinīs who abide in the three abodes, the assembly of deities who reside in the twenty-four countries and in Akaniṣṭha, holding various flowers in their hands.

original: lha rdzas kyi me tog padma dang / autpala dang / ku mu ta dang / punda r'i ka dang / manydzu sha ka la sogs pas mchod par byed /🔽lha'i rin po che'i rgyal mtshan sna tshogs du ma dang / ba da na sna tshogs pa du ma dang gdugs dang bla re chen po dang 'phan la sogs pa dang / rol mo'i sgra ni sna tshogs pa dung dang rdo po che dang gand'i dang /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi me tog padma dang / autpala dang / ku mu ta dang / punda r'i ka dang / manydzu sha ka la sogs pas mchod par byed / lha'i rin po che'i rgyal mtshan sna tshogs du ma dang / ba da na sna tshogs pa du ma dang gdugs dang bla re chen po dang 'phan la sogs pa dang / rol mo'i sgra ni sna tshogs pa dung dang rdo po che dang gand'i dang /
translated: They make offerings with divine substances, such as lotuses, utpalas, kumutas, punnāgas, and mañjūṣakas.🔽They make offerings with various divine precious victory banners, various banners, parasols, canopies, and streamers, and with various musical sounds, such as conches, kettledrums, gongs,

original: bi wang dang / gleng bu dang / rgyud mangs dang / pa ta ha dang / pheg rdob pa dang / ta ma ru dang / dril bu la sogs pa du ma sgrogs par byed cing /
analyzed: bi wang dang / gleng bu dang / rgyud mangs dang / pa ta ha dang / pheg rdob pa dang / ta ma ru dang / dril bu la sogs pa du ma sgrogs par byed cing /
translated: lutes, flutes, vīṇās, vīṇās with many strings, paṭaha drums, cymbals, and tāns, which are played in many ways.

original: sna tshogs klu'i mchod pas mchod pa ni drug ldan dang bzhi 'gyur la sogs pa rdo rje'i dbyangs yid du 'ong ba du ma ni lha mo'i tshogs thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs klu'i mchod pas mchod pa ni drug ldan dang bzhi 'gyur la sogs pa rdo rje'i dbyangs yid du 'ong ba du ma ni lha mo'i tshogs thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They make offerings with various nāga offerings, such as the six-fold and four-fold vajra songs that are pleasing to the mind, which are offered by all the hosts of goddesses.

original: tshu rol pa rnams kyis 'chi ba zhes bya ba rtags tsam du bas kyi /
analyzed: tshu rol pa rnams kyis 'chi ba zhes bya ba rtags tsam du bas kyi /
translated: The other side is merely the sign called “death.”

original: sgrub pa po la 'chi ba med pas bde ba'i snang ba las @117b ma 'das te /
analyzed: sgrub pa po la 'chi ba med pas bde ba'i snang ba las @117b ma 'das te /
translated: But for the adept, there is no death, and so he does not go beyond the appearance of bliss.

original: rnam rtog 'di zhes gzhan dag rnams kyi 'khrul snang yen no //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'di zhes gzhan dag rnams kyi 'khrul snang yen no //
translated: This is the delusion of others, who think in terms of “conceptualization.”

original: mkha' la spyod pa'i gnas su khrid pa ni lus 'ja' tshon lta bu'i rnam pa la sems ye shes bde stong du gyur ba nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i skur 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkha' la spyod pa'i gnas su khrid pa ni lus 'ja' tshon lta bu'i rnam pa la sems ye shes bde stong du gyur ba nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i skur 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “leading to the abode of space-travel” is that the body, in the form of a rainbow, and the mind, which has become the bliss-void gnosis, are transformed into the immaculate body.

original: des ni dbang po 'bring gi lam mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni dbang po 'bring gi lam mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: This is the path of the person of medium faculties.

original: phan yon de dag kyang phal pa rnams la 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phan yon de dag kyang phal pa rnams la 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: These benefits do not occur for ordinary people.

original: de 'dra'i dpal chen de sgrub pa po dang / rnal 'byor ba lus dag yid lha'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje dang tha mi dad du gyur ba dag sa steng nas ni rnyed par dka' ba ste au du mw'a ra lta bu srid pa tsam du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra'i dpal chen de sgrub pa po dang / rnal 'byor ba lus dag yid lha'i sku gsung thugs rdo rje dang tha mi dad du gyur ba dag sa steng nas ni rnyed par dka' ba ste au du mw'a ra lta bu srid pa tsam du bstan pa'o //
translated: The great glory of such a one is difficult to find on the face of the earth, even by the adept and the yogi, who have become inseparable from the vajra body, speech, and mind of the deity. It is taught that it is possible, like the udumbara flower.

original: da ni bsrung bya'i dam tshig las dpal ldan he ru ka'i rgyud chen 'di la dang por zhugs shing /
analyzed: da ni bsrung bya'i dam tshig las dpal ldan he ru ka'i rgyud chen 'di la dang por zhugs shing /
translated: Now, from among the pledges to be guarded, this great glorious Heruka Tantra first teaches the faults of transgressing the pledges.🔽Having entered this,

original: dbang thob pa chos thos nas //
analyzed: dbang thob pa chos thos nas //
translated: having obtained empowerment, and having heard the Dharma,

original: gang gis bla ma dang lhag pa'i lha dang gsang ba'i spyod pa dang / mchod rdzas brten pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin shes nas ma dad pas dam tshig ma bsrungs na /
analyzed: gang gis bla ma dang lhag pa'i lha dang gsang ba'i spyod pa dang / mchod rdzas brten pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin shes nas ma dad pas dam tshig ma bsrungs na /
translated: if one does not guard the pledges due to lack of faith in the guru, the supreme deity, the secret conduct, the reliance on articles of worship, and so on,

original: tshe 'di la dbul ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdung ba la sogs pa rnam par 'tshe ba du ma 'byung la /
analyzed: tshe 'di la dbul ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdung ba la sogs pa rnam par 'tshe ba du ma 'byung la /
translated: one will experience many harms in this life, such as being tormented by the suffering of poverty, and so on.

original: skye ba phyi ma de la dus rtag tu sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba phyi ma de la dus rtag tu sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In future lives, one will always experience immeasurable suffering.

original: dam tshig las 'das pa'i skyon pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig las 'das pa'i skyon pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the faults of transgressing the pledges.

original: da ni mngon par rtogs pa sgom pa'i gzhung bsdu ba las /
analyzed: da ni mngon par rtogs pa sgom pa'i gzhung bsdu ba las /
translated: Now, in the text of the meditation on manifest realization,

original: dang por rdzus skyes rim pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang por rdzus skyes rim pa bstan pa ni /
translated: first the teaching on the stages of miraculous birth is as follows:

original: ri steng ni 'byung bzhi rim brtsegs kyi steng du ri bo mchog rab po //
analyzed: ri steng ni 'byung bzhi rim brtsegs kyi steng du ri bo mchog rab po //
translated: On the mountain is the supreme mountain on top of the stacked up four elements.

original: sna tshogs padma ni 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa de'i lte bar sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad par gnas pa la /
analyzed: sna tshogs padma ni 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa de'i lte bar sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad par gnas pa la /
translated: The multicolored lotus has thirty-two petals. In its center is a multicolored vajra cross, in the center of which is an eight-petaled lotus.

original: yi ge sa bon tsam las a'a li k'a li skyes ni dbyangs dang / gsal byed kyi dbus su h'um 'od 'phro ba las /
analyzed: yi ge sa bon tsam las a'a li k'a li skyes ni dbyangs dang / gsal byed kyi dbus su h'um 'od 'phro ba las /
translated: From the mere seed syllable, the vowels and consonants are generated. In the center of the vowels and consonants, light radiates from hūṃ.

original: spro bsdu nas skad cig gis gzhal yas khang lha'i 'khor lo lnga ldan du bcas pa rdzogs byed du rnam par blta ste /
analyzed: spro bsdu nas skad cig gis gzhal yas khang lha'i 'khor lo lnga ldan du bcas pa rdzogs byed du rnam par blta ste /
translated: Through emanating and gathering, in an instant the celestial mansion is complete with the five wheels of deities.

original: dpal he ru zhabs g-yas brkyang bas lha mo au ma dus mtshan mo mnan cing /
analyzed: dpal he ru zhabs g-yas brkyang bas lha mo au ma dus mtshan mo mnan cing /
translated: Śrī Heruka stands with his right leg straight, pressing on the goddess Umā and the night goddess.

original: zhabs g-yon pas de'i bdag po 'jigs byed sum bltab tu rnam par gnon cing ste chad pa dang rtag par lta ba 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs g-yon pas de'i bdag po 'jigs byed sum bltab tu rnam par gnon cing ste chad pa dang rtag par lta ba 'joms pa'o //
translated: With his left leg he tramples on their lord, Bhairava, in the manner of pressing down.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sku la 'khyud cing mnyam sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sku la 'khyud cing mnyam sbyor ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavān holds a vajra and a bell with his first two hands and embraces the body of Vajrayoginī, uniting in union.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi phyed ldan pa na phyag bcu @118a * //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi phyed ldan pa na phyag bcu @118a * //
translated: When the twenty-four are half-endowed, there are twelve hands.

original: gnyis rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang sa bcu gnyis rdzogs pas bcu gsum rdo rje 'dzin pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang sa bcu gnyis rdzogs pas bcu gsum rdo rje 'dzin pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Since the twelve links of dependent origination and the twelve stages are perfected, one abides in the thirteenth stage of Vajradhara.

original: 'ga' zhig gis lha bcu gsum pa'i tshig zin du 'dod pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis lha bcu gsum pa'i tshig zin du 'dod pa'ang yod do //
translated: Some assert that the thirteen deities are literally so.

original: dpa' bo ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The heroes are the assembly abiding in the wheels of body, speech, and mind.

original: rnal 'byor ma tshogs d'a ki ma sum cu rtsa drug gis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma tshogs d'a ki ma sum cu rtsa drug gis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The assembly of yoginīs is the retinue of thirty-six ḍākinīs.

original: de rnams kyi sku'i rgyan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku'i rgyan ni /
translated: The ornaments of their bodies are as follows:

original: spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo thod pa lnga nor bu dang ldan pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya dang / mgul rgyan rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgya /
analyzed: spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo thod pa lnga nor bu dang ldan pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya dang / mgul rgyan rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgya /
translated: The crown wheel with five skulls and a jewel is the mudra of Akṣobhya, the necklace is the mudra of Ratnasambhava,

original: lag pa gdu bu dpung rgyan de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya /
analyzed: lag pa gdu bu dpung rgyan de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya /
translated: the bracelets and armlets are the mudra of the tathāgata family,

original: rna rgyan 'od dpag med kyi phyag rgya /
analyzed: rna rgyan 'od dpag med kyi phyag rgya /
translated: the earrings are the mudra of Amitābha,🔽and the belt is the mudra of Amoghasiddhi.

original: tshangs pa'i skud pa mchod phyir thogs dang ska rags 'og pags sil sil sgra sgrogs pa ni dam tshig rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i skud pa mchod phyir thogs dang ska rags 'og pags sil sil sgra sgrogs pa ni dam tshig rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The sacred thread, the sacrificial cord, and the belt that makes a hissing sound on the skin are the pledge seal of the family.

original: thal ba'i rdul gyis byugs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag nyid do //
analyzed: thal ba'i rdul gyis byugs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag nyid do //
translated: The application of the dust of ashes is the seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: do shal mgo bo'o phreng ba ni mi mgo khrag 'dzag pa can lnga bcu thag pa rgyu mas byas pa 'du byed lnga bcu dag pa'i brda'o //
analyzed: do shal mgo bo'o phreng ba ni mi mgo khrag 'dzag pa can lnga bcu thag pa rgyu mas byas pa 'du byed lnga bcu dag pa'i brda'o //
translated: The garland of heads is a garland of fifty dripping human heads, made of thread of entrails, a symbol of the purification of the fifty thought constructions.

original: sh'i he ru ka phyag rgya chen po ni /
analyzed: sh'i he ru ka phyag rgya chen po ni /
translated: The great seal of the flesh Heruka

original: bcom ldan 'khor lo lnga'i dbus na sku lnga bde chen du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'khor lo lnga'i dbus na sku lnga bde chen du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: is the five bodies of the Bhagavat dwelling in great bliss in the middle of the five chakras.

original: go 'phang mchog ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: go 'phang mchog ni bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the supreme state.

original: zhes pas dngos grub thams cad sgrub par 'dod pas thun bzhi rim pas gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pas dngos grub thams cad sgrub par 'dod pas thun bzhi rim pas gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to accomplish all powers should remain in the four periods of the day.

original: da ni mang la skyes ltar na khyad par ni dpa' bo nyer bzhi po kun dang rnal 'byor ma sum cu so drug pa'i 'khor lo lnga ldan du gyur ba bha ga'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su dpal he ru ka yab yum sbyor ldan bsrubs bas pa las
analyzed: da ni mang la skyes ltar na khyad par ni dpa' bo nyer bzhi po kun dang rnal 'byor ma sum cu so drug pa'i 'khor lo lnga ldan du gyur ba bha ga'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su dpal he ru ka yab yum sbyor ldan bsrubs bas pa las
translated: Now, in the case of the many births, the special feature is that the glorious Heruka father and mother in union in the center of the bhaga mandala are churned by all twenty-four heroes and the retinue of thirty-six yoginis.

original: byung ba'i mngon par byang chub pa lnga las byung ba rgyu'i he ru ka rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i mngon par byang chub pa lnga las byung ba rgyu'i he ru ka rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The resultant Heruka arises from the five manifest awakenings that arise from the churning of the father and mother.

original: 'byin pa dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor du bkod pas /
analyzed: 'byin pa dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor du bkod pas /
translated: The emanation is the array in the pledge mandala.

original: sdud pa gtso bo yan yum zhu ba ni stong nyid 'ong gsal du 'jug par mdzad pa yin zhes thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa la /
analyzed: sdud pa gtso bo yan yum zhu ba ni stong nyid 'ong gsal du 'jug par mdzad pa yin zhes thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa la /
translated: The gathering is the melting of the principal mother and father, which is the entry into the clarity of emptiness.🔽The song of the goddesses in the intermediate directions urges the bindu to remain in the form of a vital essence.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo'i glus bskul bas lha tshogs thams cad dgyes pas khyab par gyur cing gnyis med 'gyur ba 'bras bu'i he ru ka slar bzhengs pa nyid cho ga bla na med pa ting nge 'dzin gsum du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo'i glus bskul bas lha tshogs thams cad dgyes pas khyab par gyur cing gnyis med 'gyur ba 'bras bu'i he ru ka slar bzhengs pa nyid cho ga bla na med pa ting nge 'dzin gsum du bstan pa'o //
translated: The arousal of all the hosts of deities with joy and the nondual transformation is the resultant Heruka arising again.

original: de las bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya 'gro ba rnams kyi mos pa'i bye brag dang dbang po'i bye brag tha dad pa du ma'i sems can la sku'i rnam @118b par 'phrul ba gang la gang 'dul du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de las bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya 'gro ba rnams kyi mos pa'i bye brag dang dbang po'i bye brag tha dad pa du ma'i sems can la sku'i rnam @118b par 'phrul ba gang la gang 'dul du ston pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One displays the emanations of his body in various ways to the many different kinds of beings who are to be trained, in accordance with their different interests and faculties.

original: spyod pa sna tshogs ston mdzad de ni zhi ba dang khro bo dang nyan rang dang bo dhi stva rnal 'byor dbang phyug dang zhal gdong brnyan mi 'dra bar gar gyi rol pas sna tshogs tshul gyis thun mong dang khyad par gyis 'khor ba ma stongs par du
analyzed: spyod pa sna tshogs ston mdzad de ni zhi ba dang khro bo dang nyan rang dang bo dhi stva rnal 'byor dbang phyug dang zhal gdong brnyan mi 'dra bar gar gyi rol pas sna tshogs tshul gyis thun mong dang khyad par gyis 'khor ba ma stongs par du
translated: He displays various kinds of conduct, peaceful and wrathful, as a śrāvaka, a pratyekabuddha, a bodhisattva, a lord of yogins, with different faces and forms, in various ways through the play of dance.

original: gdul bya nam mkha' dang mnyam pa la thabs ni sna tshogs sgyu ma lta bu'i spros ba dang / yang spros pa med pa zab pa dang / rgya che ba du ma ston pa yin zhes snod dang 'tsham par ro //
analyzed: gdul bya nam mkha' dang mnyam pa la thabs ni sna tshogs sgyu ma lta bu'i spros ba dang / yang spros pa med pa zab pa dang / rgya che ba du ma ston pa yin zhes snod dang 'tsham par ro //
translated: Until saṃsāra is emptied, he displays various means to those to be trained, who are as limitless as space, with various emanations that are like illusions, and also without emanations, teaching the profound and the vast in many ways, in accordance with the vessels.

original: da ni gsang chen bla na med pa zab mo snying po'i chos 'di ni he ru ka ngas ston pa la 'ga' zhig gal te /
analyzed: da ni gsang chen bla na med pa zab mo snying po'i chos 'di ni he ru ka ngas ston pa la 'ga' zhig gal te /
translated: Now, in this Dharma of the profound essence, the unsurpassed Great Secret, Heruka teaches that even if some people do not have devotion,

original: mos par ma gyur kyang zhes dbang po dman pas 'di la mi 'jug na yang smod pa dag tu mi bya ste /
analyzed: mos par ma gyur kyang zhes dbang po dman pas 'di la mi 'jug na yang smod pa dag tu mi bya ste /
translated: if those of lesser capacity do not engage in this, they should not disparage it.

original: tshar bcad pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: tshar bcad pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: It is the domain of those to be subdued.

original: chos nyid bsam mi khyab dran bya ni thams cad la blo'i yul las 'das pa phyag rgya chen po yid la mi byed pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid bsam mi khyab dran bya ni thams cad la blo'i yul las 'das pa phyag rgya chen po yid la mi byed pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: One should recall the inconceivable dharmata, abiding in the mahāmudrā that transcends the domain of the mind, the non-mentation of the inconceivable.

original: yang gang zag gang gis chos 'di bdag gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul min pas sus kyang 'di'i don mngon du gyur pa med pa'i shes byed ni /
analyzed: yang gang zag gang gis chos 'di bdag gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul min pas sus kyang 'di'i don mngon du gyur pa med pa'i shes byed ni /
translated: Again, the evidence that this Dharma is not the domain of realization of any person, and that no one has actualized its meaning, is

original: bdag gis chos 'di'i chos nyid ni ma rtogs pas gzhan dag kyang ma shes pa yin no zhes zer pa can ni ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis chos 'di'i chos nyid ni ma rtogs pas gzhan dag kyang ma shes pa yin no zhes zer pa can ni ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: those who say, Since I have not realized the dharmatā of this Dharma, I do not understand others, are those who have not realized it.

original: gang gis mngon du byed pa bstan pa rdzogs sangs rgyas dang zhes dbang po yang rab dang de'i sras ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang 'bring pa rnams dang bdag nyid chen po gang zag thod rgal ba rnal 'byor dbang phyug tu gyur ba rnams kyis
analyzed: gang gis mngon du byed pa bstan pa rdzogs sangs rgyas dang zhes dbang po yang rab dang de'i sras ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang 'bring pa rnams dang bdag nyid chen po gang zag thod rgal ba rnal 'byor dbang phyug tu gyur ba rnams kyis
translated: The explanation of who actualizes it is “the perfect buddhas” and so on.

original: mkhyen cing mngon du gyur par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen cing mngon du gyur par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The buddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the great beings who are yoginis and yogins have realized and actualized it.

original: de la chos thams cad chos nyid lhun grub 'gyur ba med par ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad chos nyid lhun grub 'gyur ba med par ston pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate that all phenomena are the spontaneously present dharmata that is unchanging,

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byon rgyur tam //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byon rgyur tam //
translated: it is said, “Whether buddhas appear or not.”

original: zhes 'jig rten du de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa byon nas chos dpag tu med pa gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: zhes 'jig rten du de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa byon nas chos dpag tu med pa gsungs pa'am /
translated: In this world, countless tathagatas have appeared and taught countless dharmas.

original: ma byon na yang chos mang po ma gsungs na yang dus dang rnam pa kun du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ye shes bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpal bde mchog gi 'khor lo'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dbyings
analyzed: ma byon na yang chos mang po ma gsungs na yang dus dang rnam pa kun du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ye shes bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpal bde mchog gi 'khor lo'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dbyings
translated: Even if he does not come, even if he does not teach many dharmas, at all times and in all ways, the essence of the dharmata of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, the inconceivable great bliss of the gnosis of the body, voice, and mind of all tathāgatas, is the dhātu.🔽

original: ye shes dbyer med la ni 'phel 'grib spangs pa ste zung 'jug rab tu mi gnas pa brjod pa las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes dbyer med la ni 'phel 'grib spangs pa ste zung 'jug rab tu mi gnas pa brjod pa las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: Even if he had not come, or if he had not taught many dharmas, at all times and in all ways, the essence of the dharmatā of the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, the inconceivable great bliss of the gnosis of the body, voice, and mind of all tathāgatas, is the space of the indivisible gnosis, free from increase and decrease, the utter transcendence of the stage of nonabiding.

original: de ltar chos ni tshig dang don du bcas pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos ni tshig dang don du bcas pa /
translated: Thus, the dharma, with its words and meanings,

original: brjod bya'i gsang ba dang rjod byed kyi @119a * //
analyzed: brjod bya'i gsang ba dang rjod byed kyi @119a * //
translated: is the secret of the object of expression and the secret of the means of expression.

original: gsang chen 'di la lung dang rigs pas rnam par gzhal nas kyang zhes gang zag dbang po rnon po la dgongs nas gsang chen byin rlabs gsang ba mchog tu gyur pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: gsang chen 'di la lung dang rigs pas rnam par gzhal nas kyang zhes gang zag dbang po rnon po la dgongs nas gsang chen byin rlabs gsang ba mchog tu gyur pa bstan pa la /
translated: Having analyzed this great secret with scripture and logic, it is also said that the great secret, the supreme secret empowerment, is explained for the purpose of those of the highest capacity.

original: 'jig rten pa tha snyad pa dngos po la mtshan mar 'dzin pa kun gyis yong mi smad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa tha snyad pa dngos po la mtshan mar 'dzin pa kun gyis yong mi smad de /
translated: It is not at all disparaged by all mundane conventional designations of entities.

original: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs kyi spros pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs kyi spros pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it transcends the elaborations of superimposition and denial.🔽In particular, the essence of the secret is that the path of this supreme, swift and blissful path is contemplated.

original: khyad par snying po gsang ba de'i 'grong pa lam myur zhing bde ba'i lam mchog 'dir bsams shing zhes chos sku zab pa dbyings ye shes ro mnyam pa'i ngang las /
analyzed: khyad par snying po gsang ba de'i 'grong pa lam myur zhing bde ba'i lam mchog 'dir bsams shing zhes chos sku zab pa dbyings ye shes ro mnyam pa'i ngang las /
translated: From within the state of the profound dharmakāya, the equality of the basic space of phenomena and wisdom,

original: rgya che ba sangs rgyas gzugs sku'i rnam par rol pa gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
analyzed: rgya che ba sangs rgyas gzugs sku'i rnam par rol pa gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
translated: the vast display of the buddhas’ rūpakāya is the inconceivable secret.

original: sku gsung thugs mi zad brgyan gyi 'khor lo thams cad mkhyen pa //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs mi zad brgyan gyi 'khor lo thams cad mkhyen pa //
translated: The wheel of the inexhaustible ornaments of body, speech, and mind is omniscience.

original: ngo bo nyid bde ba chen po byang chub sems lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bde ba chen po byang chub sems lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: The essence itself is the spontaneously present awakened mind of great bliss.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug pa bstan pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug pa bstan pa ni //
translated: The explanation of the introduction to the Buddha’s teachings:

original: mdo sde ni mtshan nyid kyi theg pa chung du dang theg pa chen po rnams so //
analyzed: mdo sde ni mtshan nyid kyi theg pa chung du dang theg pa chen po rnams so //
translated: The sūtras are the Hīnayāna and Mahāyāna vehicles of characteristics.

original: ji srid bya ba spyod sogs kri ya dang tsarya spyod pa'i rgyud dang rnal 'byor gyi bar rdo rje theg pa spyi'o //
analyzed: ji srid bya ba spyod sogs kri ya dang tsarya spyod pa'i rgyud dang rnal 'byor gyi bar rdo rje theg pa spyi'o //
translated: The conduct tantras, such as the Kriyā and Caryā, and the yoga tantras up to the Vajrayāna are the general tantras.

original: khyad par ba rnal 'byor gsang mtha' ste bla na med pa dbye ba nyid ni rgyud sde bzhi rim pas 'jug pa la sems can mos pas 'jug pa rnams blo'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par ba rnal 'byor gsang mtha' ste bla na med pa dbye ba nyid ni rgyud sde bzhi rim pas 'jug pa la sems can mos pas 'jug pa rnams blo'i rim pa'am /
translated: The special, secret yoga is the unexcelled division itself, which is taught in the four classes of tantra.🔽The four joys are taught in order to introduce sentient beings who are interested in the four classes of tantra.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags tshul rim pas bstan pa de dang / de la dga' ba bzhis zhes drang ba dang nges pa dang snying po'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags tshul rim pas bstan pa de dang / de la dga' ba bzhis zhes drang ba dang nges pa dang snying po'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: The four joys are taught in order to introduce sentient beings who are interested in the four classes of tantra.

original: mtshan gyis rab grol dbang phyug bde chen go 'phang yan lag mngon 'gyur mi phyed gnas thob pa //
analyzed: mtshan gyis rab grol dbang phyug bde chen go 'phang yan lag mngon 'gyur mi phyed gnas thob pa //
translated: The one who is liberated by the name, the lord of great bliss, who has actualized the limbs, and who has attained the stage of non-differentiation,

original: gang zag au dum ltar te phyir ldog gang yin 'khor bar lhung la phyag rgyar grub pas lam gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zag au dum ltar te phyir ldog gang yin 'khor bar lhung la phyag rgyar grub pas lam gyur pa //
translated: The person who is like an udumbara flower, who has turned back, who has fallen into samsara, who has attained the path through accomplishment in the mudra,

original: skad cig dag gis rdzogs bye rnal 'byor de nyid gsang ba srid pa skye tshul dang mtshungs ston //
analyzed: skad cig dag gis rdzogs bye rnal 'byor de nyid gsang ba srid pa skye tshul dang mtshungs ston //
translated: The yogin who is perfected in an instant, who teaches the secret of reality in a way that is similar to the way of birth in existence,

original: 'gro ba skal ldan skal med 'jig rten dag na chos rnams dag cing bdag med mnyam pa nyid du rang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba skal ldan skal med 'jig rten dag na chos rnams dag cing bdag med mnyam pa nyid du rang 'byung ba'o //
translated: The self-arisen one in the world, who is fortunate or unfortunate, who is pure in phenomena, and who is the equality of selflessness.

original: nyan rang theg chen zhugs dang bram zer spyod dang brtul zhugs can de rnal 'byor rjes su rigs pa dang // mnyam sbyor mi 'gyur de nyid thams cad sems kyi spyod yul gsang ba mi zad chen por brtag //
analyzed: nyan rang theg chen zhugs dang bram zer spyod dang brtul zhugs can de rnal 'byor rjes su rigs pa dang // mnyam sbyor mi 'gyur de nyid thams cad sems kyi spyod yul gsang ba mi zad chen por brtag //
translated: The Listeners, the Self-realized Buddhas, those who have entered the Great Vehicle, the Brahmins, the practitioners, the ascetics, the yogis, the followers of the Anuyoga, and the practitioners of the Great Perfection—🔽none of them have united with the union, and so they do not realize the nature of reality, the inseparability of appearance and emptiness.

original: gang du stong dang rje dbyer med chos nyid bden pa'i don ni mi rtogs byin rlabs bral //
analyzed: gang du stong dang rje dbyer med chos nyid bden pa'i don ni mi rtogs byin rlabs bral //
translated: They are devoid of blessings,🔽and they do not see the meaning of the teachings.

original: tshul ngan rig byed ge'i gzhung lugs log par lta la zhen byas rig @119b don ma mthong //🔽bla ma'i man ngag bral ba'i skye bo rtog pa'i dra bas bcings pa rnams kyis rtogs min pa /
analyzed: tshul ngan rig byed ge'i gzhung lugs log par lta la zhen byas rig @119b don ma mthong // bla ma'i man ngag bral ba'i skye bo rtog pa'i dra bas bcings pa rnams kyis rtogs min pa /
translated: They are attached to the wrong view of the Vedic scriptures,🔽and they are bound by the web of concepts.🔽The tantra of the heart essence of the Great Secret🔽is not realized by those who lack the instructions of the guru.

original: gsang chen snying po'i rgyud ni dri med 'phags pa'i nor gyi blo ldan spyod yul dag tu ni //
analyzed: gsang chen snying po'i rgyud ni dri med 'phags pa'i nor gyi blo ldan spyod yul dag tu ni //
translated: It is the domain of the wise, who are endowed with the wealth of stainless noble beings.🔽It is protected by the wise, who show the right path to those who are fortunate,

original: log lta nyams byed skal bar ldan rnams yang dag lam ston mkhas rnams bsrung //
analyzed: log lta nyams byed skal bar ldan rnams yang dag lam ston mkhas rnams bsrung //
translated: and who destroy the wrong views of those who are not.

original: mi bzed snyigs dus rtsod pa'i 'gro rnams gsang chen lam rtogs bya phyir da nyid de yi tshe na yang //
analyzed: mi bzed snyigs dus rtsod pa'i 'gro rnams gsang chen lam rtogs bya phyir da nyid de yi tshe na yang //
translated: In order to cause the beings of the age of strife to realize the path of the Great Secret,

original: dus dang dus su snying po'i don ston bla ma nyid du gyur nas bstan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: dus dang dus su snying po'i don ston bla ma nyid du gyur nas bstan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: at that very time, the teacher himself will appear as the guru who reveals the meaning of the essence from time to time.

original: dpal ldan sngom pa chen po yon tan rgya mtsho'i 'byung gnas gsang ba mdzod 'di gsang ba'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan sngom pa chen po yon tan rgya mtsho'i 'byung gnas gsang ba mdzod 'di gsang ba'i don ston pa'o //
translated: This treasury of secrets, the origin of the ocean of qualities of the glorious great hero, reveals the secret meaning.

original: de la brjod bya dang rjod byed du bcas pa'i rgyud kyi mtshan gyi rnam grangs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la brjod bya dang rjod byed du bcas pa'i rgyud kyi mtshan gyi rnam grangs bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the synonyms of the tantra with the expressed meaning and the means of expression:

original: dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam thar sgo gsum skad cig ma rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam thar sgo gsum skad cig ma rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The glorious Heruka is the pure moment of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind, the three doors of liberation.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal bo ni bla na med pa'i gsang chen no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal bo ni bla na med pa'i gsang chen no //
translated: The king of tantras is the unsurpassed Great Secret.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa 'bum pa'i nang nas byung bzhes khyad par snying po lta bu nyid de rgya mtsho chen po las nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po ltar ston pa dpal rdo rje dril bu bas gdan drangs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa 'bum pa'i nang nas byung bzhes khyad par snying po lta bu nyid de rgya mtsho chen po las nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po ltar ston pa dpal rdo rje dril bu bas gdan drangs pa'o //
translated: The essence is like the essence of the essence, and is like the sovereign wish-fulfilling jewel in the great ocean. It was brought forth by the teacher Srivajraghantipa from within the hundred thousand [verses] equal to space.

original: dngos grub kyi cho ga ni mchog dang thun mong gi grub pa myur du 'grub pa sbyin sreg dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi cho ga ni mchog dang thun mong gi grub pa myur du 'grub pa sbyin sreg dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The rite of power is the path of fire sacrifice, machine, and so forth, which grants the swift accomplishment of supreme and common powers.

original: shin tu rmad du byung ba ni byin rlabs phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu rmad du byung ba ni byin rlabs phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The very marvelous is the supreme blessing.

original: bstan bcos thams cad pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The all-treatise is the teaching of the perfect fruit of mundane and supramundane [realms].

original: dpal he ru ka dpa' bo chen po ni bdud las rnam par rgyal ba bklags pas 'grub pa ni /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka dpa' bo chen po ni bdud las rnam par rgyal ba bklags pas 'grub pa ni /
translated: The Sri Heruka Great Hero is the conqueror of demons, accomplished by mere recitation,

original: shin tu myur du don grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu myur du don grub par byed pa'o //
translated: which swiftly accomplishes the goal.

original: thams cad / mkhyen pa ni rang gzhan gnyis med rnam pa ma lus pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad / mkhyen pa ni rang gzhan gnyis med rnam pa ma lus pa'i don to //
translated: The all-knowing is the meaning of all aspects of non-dual self and other.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni bar du gcod pa mi 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni bar du gcod pa mi 'byung pa'o //
translated: The unconquerable is the non-occurrence of obstacles.

original: gdod ma nas grub pa ni dpal he ru ka rdo rje 'chang gi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gdod ma nas grub pa ni dpal he ru ka rdo rje 'chang gi dgongs pa'o //
translated: The primordial is the intention of glorious Heruka Vajradhara.

original: rgyud phyi ma ni dang po chen po la ltos pa'o //🔽dpal 'khor lo sngom pa zhes bya ba rgyud sde rnams las 'di rnal 'byor chen po bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po las le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so zhes yongs su bstan pa ma lus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma ni dang po chen po la ltos pa'o // dpal 'khor lo sngom pa zhes bya ba rgyud sde rnams las 'di rnal 'byor chen po bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po las le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so zhes yongs su bstan pa ma lus pa'i don to //
translated: The continuation is in relation to the great first.🔽The Glorious Wheel of Time Tantra is taught as the king of the tantras of the unsurpassed great yoga, with fifty-one chapters complete. This is the meaning of the entire teaching.

original: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal bo bde mchog bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa aindra bh'u ti'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal bo bde mchog bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa aindra bh'u ti'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra, the king of tantras, called The Condensed Supreme Bliss, composed by the master Indrabhuti.
